gurmukhi: Dwie gew gih Poir kY Pauj ko Gwau isvw isr dYq ky mwirE ]
transliteration: Dhaae Gadaa Gad(i0 Phor(i) Kai Phauj Ko Ghaau Sivaa Sir Dait Ke Maario||
translation: Holding her mace the goddess splitting the army of the enemy, struck such a blow on the head of the demon Dhumar Lochan;

gurmukhi: siRMg DrwDr aUpr ko jn kop purMdR nY b`jR pHwirE ]98]
transliteration: Sring Dharaadhar Oopar Ko Jan Kop Purandra Nai Bajra Prahaario||98||
translation: Just as Indra, in great fury, hath attacked a mountainous citadel with his weapon Vajra.98.

gurmukhi: locnDUm auTy iklkwr ley sMg dYqn ky kurmw ]
transliteration: Lochanndhoom Outhe Kilkaar Lae San Daitan Ke Kurmaa||
translation: Dhumar Locahn, shouting loudly and taking his forces with him;

gurmukhi: gih pwn kiRpwn Acwnk qwn lgweI hY kyhir ky aur mw ]
transliteration: Gad(i) Paan Kridaan Achaanak Taan Lagadoo Hai Kehar(i) Ke Ur Maa||
translation: Holding his sword in his hand, suddenly struck a blow on Lion’s body.

gurmukhi: hir cMf lieE bir kY kr qy Aru mUMf kitE AsurM pur mw ]
transliteration: Har(i) Channd Laeo Bar(i) Kai Kar Te Ar(u) Moondd Katio Asuran Pur Maa||
translation: Chandni, on the other hand , with her hand’s sword cut off the head of Dhumar Lochan, hurled it on the demons.

gurmukhi: mwno AwNDI bhy DrnI pr CUt KjUr qy tUt pirE Kurmw ]99]
transliteration: Maano Aandhoo Bade Dharnoo Par Chhodht Khajoor Te Toot Pario Khurmaa||99||
translation: Just as in a violent storm, the date falls far away, after breaking from the palm-tree.99.

gurmukhi: DUmRnYn jb mwirE dyvI ieh prkwr ]
transliteration: Dhoomranain Jab Maario D3vi Eh Parkaar||
translation: When the goddess killed Dhumar Lochan in this way;

gurmukhi: Asur sYn ibn cYn huie kIno hw hw kwr ]100]
transliteration: Asur Sian Bin Chain Hue Koono Haa Haa Kaar||100||
translation: The army of the demons, being confounded, greatly lamented.100.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI mwrkMfy purwny sRI cMfI cirqR aukiq iblws DUmR nYn bDih nwm qiRqIAw iDAwie ]3]
transliteration: It(i) Sroo Markande Puraane Sroo Channdoo Chartira Oukat(i0 Bilaas Dhoomra Nain Badhah(i) Tritooaa Dhiaae||3||
translation: End of the Third Chapter entitled ‘Slaying of Dhumar Lochan’ of CHANDI CHARITRA UKATI BILAS in Markandeya Purana. 3.

gurmukhi: soru suinE jb dYqn ko qb cMf pRcMf qcI AKIAwN ]
transliteration: Sor(u) Sounio Jab Daitan Ko Tab Channd Prachanndd Tachoo Akhooaan||
translation: When the powerful Chandi heard the furore of the demons, her eyes bhecame red with anger.

gurmukhi: hir iDAwnu CuitE mun ko suin kY Duin tUit Kgys geI pKIAwN ]
transliteration: Har(i) Dhiaan(u) Chhoutio Mounndko Soun(i0 Kai Dhoun(i) Toottee Khages Gado Pakhooaan||
translation: The contemplation of Shiva was broken by the noise and being perturbed slackened the winged flight.

gurmukhi: diRg juAwl bFI bVvwnl ijauN kiv ny aupmw iqh kI lKIAwN ]
transliteration: Drig Juaal Badhoo Badvaanal Joooun Kav(i) Ne Oupmaa Tih Koo Lakhooaan||
translation: With the fire from the eyes of the goddess, the army of the demons was reduced to ashes, the poet imagined this anloty.
